content:
Professor for AI-assisted therapy decisions in oncology, LMU University Hospital Munich
•	Leads a multidisciplinary research group at the interface of AI, oncology, and precision medicine •	Focus areas: •	AI-driven models for therapy stratification, molecular diagnostics, and outcome prediction •	Clinical applications in head and neck and brain tumors •	Background in molecular biology and bioinformatics •	Expert in multi-omics analysis, clinical trial integration, and translational oncology •	Collaborates with clinicians, pathologists, and data scientists for patient-centered cancer research •	Member of national/international consortia, incl. DKTK, BZKF, and clinical studies on biomarkers and treatment de-escalation
summary:
Professor for AI-assisted therapy decisions in oncology, LMU University Hospital Munich
•	Leads a multidisciplinary research group at the interface of AI, oncology, and precision medicine •	Focus areas: •	AI-driven models for therapy stratification, molecular diagnostics, and outcome prediction •	Clinical applications in head and neck and brain tumors •	Background in molecular biology and bioinformatics •	Expert in multi-omics analysis, clinical trial integration, and translational oncology •	Collaborates with clinicians, pathologists, and data scientists for patient-centered cancer research •	Member of national/international consortia, incl. DKTK, BZKF, and clinical studies on biomarkers and treatment de-escalation
title: Kristian Unger

content:
吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.

summary: 吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.
title: Alice Wu 吳恩達

content: Amelie is a working student at KITSO and an undergraduate medical engineering student at FAU Erlangen. She is currently working with prostate carcinoma RNA-seq data.
summary: Amelie is a working student at KITSO and an undergraduate medical engineering student at FAU Erlangen. She is currently working with prostate carcinoma RNA-seq data.
title: Amelie Daum

content: Ilka is a PhD student at KITSO working on the PRIDE-T translational study, conducting multi-omics analysis on glioblastoma (GBM) blood and tissue samples.
summary: Ilka is a PhD student at KITSO working on the PRIDE-T translational study, conducting multi-omics analysis on glioblastoma (GBM) blood and tissue samples.
title: Ilka Klose

content: Jan joined Kitso in August 2023 and is currently a senior in the joint Bioinformatics program at TUM and LMU Munich. His research focusses on miRNA signatures, signaling pathways, and transformer-based models for subtyping HNSCC tumor microenvironments.
summary: Jan joined Kitso in August 2023 and is currently a senior in the joint Bioinformatics program at TUM and LMU Munich. His research focusses on miRNA signatures, signaling pathways, and transformer-based models for subtyping HNSCC tumor microenvironments.
title: Jan P Hummel

content:
Visiting Research Fellow (2024–2025) → PhD Student, TUM, Quantum Computing
Patryk graduated from The Silesian University of Technology with a Master of Science and is a Deep Learning engineer specializing in computer vision and signal processing for multimodal clinical decision support systems in oncology.
summary:
Visiting Research Fellow (2024–2025) → PhD Student, TUM, Quantum Computing
Patryk graduated from The Silesian University of Technology with a Master of Science and is a Deep Learning engineer specializing in computer vision and signal processing for multimodal clinical decision support systems in oncology.
title: Patryk Dąbkowski

content: Rosch is a final-year medical student at Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität Munich.
summary: Rosch is a final-year medical student at Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität Munich.
title: R Rosch Abdullah

content: Robert did his PhD at the TUM School of Life Sciences and is now a postdoctoral researcher in computational biology and data science. His work focuses on HNSCC tumor microenvironments and the development of computational pipelines for multi-omics and radiomics.
summary: Robert did his PhD at the TUM School of Life Sciences and is now a postdoctoral researcher in computational biology and data science. His work focuses on HNSCC tumor microenvironments and the development of computational pipelines for multi-omics and radiomics.
title: Robert S Piecyk

content:
Slides can be added in a few ways:
Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
summary: An example event.
title: Example Event

content: Kitso lab members spent a fun late afternoon at Munich’s Christmas markets and concluded the evening at a Bavarian Wirtshaus. Merry Christmas!
summary: Kitso lab members spent a fun late afternoon at Munich’s Christmas markets and concluded the evening at a Bavarian Wirtshaus. Merry Christmas!
title: Lab Christmas Social 2025

content: Kitso gathered for the Radiation Oncology department’s annual Oktoberfest outing. Great food and even better company to kick off fall!
summary: Kitso gathered for the Radiation Oncology department’s annual Oktoberfest outing. Great food and even better company to kick off fall!
title: Kitso @ LMU RadOnc Octoberfest Social 2025

content: Kristian and lab members attended the 12th Munich Cancer Retreat of the German Cancer Consortium (DKTK). Below are photos of Robert giving a talk and Rosch presenting his poster.
summary: Kristian and lab members attended the 12th Munich Cancer Retreat of the German Cancer Consortium (DKTK). Below are photos of Robert giving a talk and Rosch presenting his poster.

summary: Development of radiomics-based machine learning models for predicting local tumor control after stereotactic radiosurgery in brain metastases patients.
title: Radiomics-based prediction of local tumor control in patients with brain metastases after stereotactic radiosurgery

content: New and senior KITSO lab members recently gathered at the LMU Hospital’s Department of Radiation Oncology for a tour and detailed explanation of diagnostic and treatment procedures, including MR-guided radiotherapy and other techniques. Many thanks to our clinical colleagues for hosting us!
summary: New and senior KITSO lab members recently gathered at the LMU Hospital’s Department of Radiation Oncology for a tour and detailed explanation of diagnostic and treatment procedures, including MR-guided radiotherapy and other techniques. Many thanks to our clinical colleagues for hosting us!
title: Radiation Oncology tour

summary: Identification of DNA methylation biomarkers for outcome prediction in locally advanced NSCLC patients treated with chemoradiotherapy.
title: DNA methylation signatures predict outcome in locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer patients treated with chemoradiotherapy

summary: Investigation of circulating tumor DNA as an early biomarker for radiotherapy response monitoring in solid tumors.
title: Circulating tumor DNA dynamics during radiotherapy as early marker for treatment response in solid tumors

summary: Epigenetic subtyping of HPV-positive head and neck cancer for improved prognostic stratification.
title: Epigenetic profiling identifies prognostic subgroups in HPV-positive head and neck cancer

summary: DNA methylation-based molecular classification and prognostic stratification in soft tissue sarcomas.
